main event: A round, silver object was observed traveling east to west and circling in the sky over Rutland, Vermont on September 20, 1959.
interesting points: The object was large in size with no reference to any known object.
The object was traveling at an unknown speed and altitude.
The object was observed for 2-3 minutes, circling and traveling in a generally straight path across the sky.
No other witnesses were reported, only a civilian housewife whose reliability was assessed as 'fair'.
The sighting occurred on a clear day with high, scattered clouds and minimal wind.
